sources.title: Jackie Robinson Story, The
sources.description: This biography of Jackie Robinson is not a great film. More than anything it represents a significant milestone in baseball and the civil right movement. Jackie doesn't do a terrible acting job which you don't really notice because the screen play, although light, is very face paced. The viewer is rocketed through the life of a young pre-teen Jackie Robinson, his football college career, touches on his military service in the second world war, his minor league career, and through his 1949 season with the Brooklyn Dodgers.

sources.title: 1950 - The Jackie Robinson Story - How One Man SMASHED Barriers - Sport Biography
sources.description:
After a successful baseball career in college and as a coach in the military, Jackie Robinson (playing himself) attracts the attention of Major League Baseball's Branch Rickey (Minor Watson). Rickey wants Robinson to play in the minor leagues, believing he can become the first player to break the color barrier and play in the majors. The only catch: He is forbidden from defending himself against racial bigotry. Supported by his wife (Ruby Dee), Robinson is steadfast in his determination to win.

Directed by Alfred E. Green
Written by Arthur Mann & Lawrence Taylor
Cinematography by Ernest Laszlo

Cast:
Jackie Robinson - Himself
Ruby Dee - Rae Robinson
Minor Watson - Branch Rickey
Louise Beavers - Jackie's mother
Richard Lane - Clay Hopper
Harry Shannon - Frank Shaughnessy 
Ben Lessy - Shorty
Bill Spaulding - Himself
Billy Wayne - Clyde Sukeforth
Joel Fluellen - Mack Robinson
Bernie Hamilton - Ernie
Kenny Washington - Tigers Manager
Pat Flaherty - Karpen
Larry McGrath - Umpire
Howard Louis MacNeely - Jackie as a boy
George Dockstader - Bill

sources.title: The Jackie Robinson Story (1950) BIOGRAPHY
sources.description:
Stars: Jackie Robinson, Ruby Dee, Minor Watson 
 Director: Alfred E. Green

 Biography of Jackie Robinson, the first black major league baseball player in the 20th century. Traces his career in the negro leagues and the major leagues.
